item.title: Good Meetings
item.description: What makes a good meeting? The first question should be, why is a good meeting important? What’s the purpose of meetings?

item.title: Start with a toy
item.description: Stole this idea from Start with a toy â€” Gordon Brander Instead of starting with a “product”, start with what might be considered a toy: fun, simple, not particularly productive.

item.title: Technology only matters when it enables new UX
item.description: caveats: this is most applicable to personal computing systems. medicine, industry, etc doesn’t put such a premium on UX. decentralized, distributed protocols are a great idea in principle.

item.title: Technology, technique, methodology, method, practice
item.description: related concepts. what are they, how do they differ and why is that difference significant? could be similar to [[strategy vs tactic]]

item.title: The Grove
item.description: Can be called a digital garden. What is it? [[notes/Topographical website|topographical]], not chronological perpetually in progress, iterative attempt to [[notes/Learn in public]] Note types/roles/statuses:

item.title: The Manager's Toolkit
item.description: What are a managers tools? managers work with people, so a manager’s tools are people focused. metaphor: a hammer is a carpenter’s tool.

item.title: Topographical website
item.description: website is a space, webdesign is architecture Links My website is a shifting house next to a river of knowledge.

item.title: Unsorted links
item.description: All you need is links - by Gordon Brander - Subconscious Decentralization enables permissionless innovation sort of antifragility concept but more practical, variety, range of motion, more freedom means less fragility, more adaptibility.
